problem_text:
Describe all simply reducible groups, that is, groups such that all their char-
acters are real and the tensor product of any two irreducible representations contains
no multiple components. This question is interesting for physicists. Is every finite
simply reducible group soluble?
S. P. Strunkov
answer: Yes, it is (L. S. Kazarin, E. I. Chankov, Sb. Math., 201, no. 5 (2010), 655–668).
